Class Deletion

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.conqat.engine.resource.text.filter.base.Deletion

    public class Deletion
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Deletion>, java.io.Serializable
    A deletion of a piece of text determined by offsets into a string.
    See Also:

        Returns end position of deletion (exclusive).

      • isGap

        public boolean isGap()
        If this returns true, the deletion is a gap, i.e. clones and findings should not cross the deletion.

        Sorts by startOffset.

        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • compactDeletions

        public static java.util.List<Deletion> compactDeletions(java.util.List<Deletion> deletions)
        Returns a list of deletions that is equivalent (i.e. the same intervals are excluded), but the intervals are in ascending order and do not overlap. Gapped deletions are dominant during merging, e.g. if a non-gapped and a gapped deletion are merged, the new deletion is gapped.

      • isFilteredOffset

        public static boolean isFilteredOffset(int offset,
                                       java.util.Collection<Deletion> filterDeletions)
        Returns:
        whether the given offset lies within one of the given filtered regions.
